title: Epistemological Approach to Overcoming Learning Difficulties: Constructivist and Experiential Science Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic concepts of secondary science education and practical experience
context.additional_context: For current secondary science teachers: designing a project-based learning environment using digital devices, focusing on bridging gaps between learners' prior experiences and scientific concepts

learning_goals: Learners develop a framework to analyze discrepancies between daily experiences and scientific concepts

Learners can diagnose three or more conceptual errors encountered during a science project from an epistemological perspective (e.g., empiricism, rationalism) and propose at least two improvement strategies per error type in a report.

Learners can incorporate peer feedback three or more times, write two reflective practice journals, and design educational materials (PDF or PPT, ~10 pages) applying three constructivist learning principles (learner-centered activities, contextual problem-solving, social interaction).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
